title: The state of autofill (More ranting fun)
body:
I know this has been talked about a lot but let me address something about autofill and its impact on the game, so Riots logic for autofill was the apparent "long queue times" for people in high elo having to wait 1 hour for a game. I understand that, however you can't just make a change to role selecting like that "because of high elo" and not expect low elo to be affected. Do Riot understand that high and low elo are that significantly different? I was often told that to climb out of low elo "you should focus on two roles" yet now I'm forced to play every role including the ones I don't enjoy? No League is not about "learning and playing all roles" League is about having fun, even in ranked I play semi-competitively, I play seriously to win but I still want to have fun. Unfortunately I don't have fun playing support, support can be left to those who enjoy playing it but god forbid don't force me into it. Listen Riot you got a problem with high elo queue times? Take a look at this -----> Autofilled enabled in Diamond+

If you see or have anything wrong with that idea please, feel free to let me know in the comments, I'm curious if anyone else can solve such a simplistic problem.

Just a side note, yes, I would rather wait 10+ minutes to get my roles then play support :)

replies.body:
Then
Than
Please know the difference.
Pretty sure everyone on the boards gives 0 shits about grammar

> [{quoted}](name=Fitzky,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=yfAXRr7N,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-01-12T02:20:34.097+0000)
>
> Pretty sure everyone on the boards gives 0 shits about grammar

Lol. Not everyone my friend.

Autofill isn't just for high elo. Autofill is turned on anywhere there isn't a high enough population of x role. Low elo experiences enormous queue times as well when autofill is not enabled, for the simple reason that most people only know how to play 1-2 roles, and since supp/jng are not popular roles, there are very few people who want to queue as/play as them.

High elo struggles without autofill because there isn't a high enough population period. Low elo struggles because there are specific role deficits.

Then explain to me, while a support main (Myself) gets auto filled to MID or ADC (My two worse roles)
When I Q up as a support / top?

I once even had a game where I got mid, autofilled.
And the support was auto filled, while I q'ed as a support.

Das some janky as stuff then. I've only ever been autofilled twice, once was to jungle and one was to mid because someone I queued with had supp/top while I had supp/mid. If there are weird autofill cases like that I would be recording what game it was and when it was played and sending it though in a support ticket. That is not intended behaviour.

I just find it weird, Im trying to fill in that "Void" I should have quick Q times, I get roughly 3-6 mins.
and sometimes I don't even get support.

3-6 mins is about average, most of my ranked queues are about 4 or 5 though usually a bit shorter if it's flex, mind I haven't played super recently. The 3-6 minutes is essentially ensuring match quality, i.e matching your mmr with your team and your enemy as closely as possible. 

You are filling that void, so you get essentially the "minimum" queue time, but there are still the constraints of match quality for the system to consider. It has to come up with 10 players who's positions all line up (or failing that autofill some) who are also within x MMR of each other. Hence the wait.

I have heard a couple complaints about some weird autofill stuff like you describe but usually it came down to the perfect combination of role selection and timing or a misunderstanding of the situation. You'd expect it to fuck up every once in a blue moon but not often (and certainly not often for a single player), so if it happens a lot I'd like to take a deeper look.

Hey there, I want to look into this and see if something is going wrong when this happens.

Are you able to identify which game this occurred in?

The most recent one, is the syndra game in my match history.
I believe that was a FLEX game.
I Q'ed as Support - Fill.
I think the amumu game was the same. (that game pissed me off)
Once again, flex Q'ed as support - top/fill.
Blitzcrank gets support, refused to talk to us (Go check the chat logs)

I asked him to buy a sightstone and all that he did, but it took him 30 mins.
I don't like someone taking my main role, feeding on purpose and refusing to do that role/job.

> [{quoted}](name=Yasei Doubutsu,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=yfAXRr7N,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-01-11T12:01:15.352+0000)
>
> Then explain to me, while a support main (Myself) gets auto filled to MID or ADC (My two worse roles)
> When I Q up as a support / top?
> 
> I once even had a game where I got mid, autofilled.
> And the support was auto filled, while I q'ed as a support.

LOL SAME. I queued up for support a couple of times and ended up mid or jg

That can happen occasionally (and is unlike what Yasei describes). Usually it happens when someone else has queued support/top or top/support. Since top is sought after more than mid/jungle that person is more likely to snag support than you. Past that it's just luck of timing/MMR.
Rubbish, I'm personally friends with bronze support mains, I would even say the majority of the bronze players I know play botlane, usually duo'ing with another player.

Bronze supports are generally duos with smurfs so they can leave bronze.
One out of ten bronze supports actually play support solo.
I play it solo! In Flex Queue :)

People you know does not equal the entire community. We tend to have our circles of relatively like-minded people so there is going to be bias there. Most of the people I know are support mains (most of the NA and OCE boards volunteers are support mains, as are quite a few of the Rioters involved) however as soon as I travel outside of those circles (boards, clubs, chat rooms etc) it becomes very apparent very quickly that there aren't that many support players (relative to the rest of the population).

It's also worth mentioning that while support mains are usually perfectly happy playing some other role like mid or top, those players who dislike support largely _despise_ it rather than simply finding it a mild inconvenience. (e.g the two people I interact with regularly who aren't support mains, and every person who's ever said "support is boring" "support is a shit role" etc etc.)

1) I've played in bronze before and hun the queue times arent even that long and i rarely get autofilled.
2) playing support or fill -> protected from actually getting the support role for like 2-3 games or more so just play one god damm game lol.
3) The definition of League of Legends could be anything depending on the person 
4) To climb out of low elo isnt just to focus on two roles, there are many factors that contribute to actually climbing out of low elo. Putting in your sense when you state that league is all about "Learning and playing all roles" actually does help you improve in league. Roles tie into other roles -> example can be when you play support you need to have good timing, positioning, map awareness etc. Map wareness is generally needed, positioning can be taken anywhere and good timing as well. Learning all roles actually give you an advantage and you become  more flexible.
5) Playing support doesnt mean actually playing a champ that is categorized as support. I've literally thrown riven down in bot lane,ahri,brand,lissandra etc (cass in bot lane was surprisingly op lol) when i got support and heck that was funny (we also won). Support can be defined as anything or if not just like the other roles. It aint hard honey.

I also rushed this because i was in cs and was 2 seconds off to getting into the loading screen so yeah, sorry if it sounds bad lol

I didn't say to climb out of low elo you JUST had to focus on two roles I meant that playing two roles was an important factor as it lets you improve on those areas specifically rather then trying to improve at everything at once which can be hard for bronze and silver players.

> [{quoted}](name=Fitzky,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=yfAXRr7N,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-01-11T12:19:36.561+0000)
>
> I didn't say to climb out of low elo you JUST had to focus on two roles I meant that playing two roles was an important factor as it lets you improve on those areas specifically rather then trying to improve at everything at once which can be hard for bronze and silver players.

But you clearly stated "_**I was often told that to climb out of low elo**_ "you should focus on two roles" yet now I'm forced to play every role including the ones I don't enjoy?" lol. Also im silver and i can play all 5 roles what does that prove? Its possible

I probably should of worded it a bit better but I too am a silver player who can **play** all 5 roles I just only enjoy playing around 2 or 3 and because of that I am significantly better at those roles then the other 2. But that doesn't mean every other player is the same as me I have seen people who enjoy playing every role and that's fine but I'm just not that kind of person.

I can play all 5 roles too, but I'm better at support-top.
The idea of the ORIGINAL Q (Before autofill) was I want X and Y, I don't care how long I have to wait.

(Like teambuilder)

But now they have gone, and made everyone pretty much be forced into things that they haven't practiced or played before.

Honestly I don't get it. I main support and I feel like I'm being penalized for playing a role fewer people want to play anyway. Fair enough if people do want some variety but that's where my home is. If you're in a desirable position you shouldn't have to select a second choice in my opinion.

I understand some people want to duo queue bot lane but I'm sure we can work around it.

There should be a checkbox after you select your roles confirming if you only want those 2 roles (it should allow you to choose one), otherwise you can get autofilled.

As for support picks getting auto-filled, Riot should ban themselves for lying to people.

Another thing to note is, the higher the ELO is, the worse auto-fill is. It's easy to be bronze level at 5 roles than diamond level at 5 roles.

I understand your frustration. I tell you now though, you can turn what you see as a 'frustration' into a competitive advantage my friend. If 1/3 games you have to support, then chances are that the other team has an autofilled support who's hating it just as much.

You need to target that disgruntled supp, who probably picked janna 'cos safe', but with the wrong runes/masteries/starter item, and disrupt them so much (i suggest blitz hooks) they tilt not only themselves, but their adc, who you will be banging out of lane all day, which in turn tilts their jungler, because you have exquisite ward and dragon control, which in turn tilts their mid, cos in your downtime you'll be strolling up the river to 'surprise' them too, then you and your jungler minion stroll top for that 3-4 man gangrape of their top laner, the coup de grace of your ruthless 'support' spree.

You'll be looking at a 20min ff game with you dancing in front of their fountain, enjoying the time of your life.

I see it ALL the time. Support domination is a plat/diamond thing.

> [{quoted}](name=Neosinf,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=yfAXRr7N,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-01-12T04:45:51.116+0000)
>
> I see it ALL the time. Support domination is a plat/diamond thing.

Definitely supports can crush bot lane but I feel they are largely dependent on the adc reacting and cooperating and working with you. The amount of games I have seen the adc with 2 yellow trinket charges permanently and not upgrading to blue even after being reminded is ridiculous. The curses of low elo.
What you need, son, is to have two support champs bot lane.
